titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: , of which he had sent me a copy. It is a curious document, disclosing a vehement unbalanced spirit, and a tortuous intellect, its too–facile instrument. After lunch I presided at a meeting of the Cosin's Hospital Trustees, at which an almswoman was selected. Then I walked with
, returning in time for Evensong. M
Knight, the Vicar of Ryhope, called, and had tea. He is unmarried, has been much abroad, and talks incessantly.
